inclusion.criterion: Referred to out-patient physical therapy for evaluation/treatment of a knee condition
inclusion.label: not_met
inclusion.evidence: Patient has a history of anaplastic astrocytoma and is being treated with high-dose steroids, which suggests they are not referred for a knee condition.

inclusion.criterion: Agreed to be in the study and signed the informed consent document
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Presence of any medical 'red flags' suggestive of pain that is not of musculoskeletal origin
exclusion.label: triggers
exclusion.evidence: Patient has a history of anaplastic astrocytoma and severe lower extremity weakness, which suggests their pain may be of non-musculoskeletal origin.

exclusion.criterion: Osteoporosis or recent fracture of the hip or spinal joints
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Spinal or hip joint surgery or prosthesis
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Spinal instability (Grade II spondylolisthesis or greater), spondyloarthritides, or severe spinal misalignment
exclusion.label: unknown
triggers
exclusion.evidence: Patient has a history of anaplastic astrocytoma, which is a nervous system disease.

notes: Key unknowns include whether the patient agreed to be in the study and signed the informed consent document, as well as their current pregnancy status.
